VIDEO | Anshuli Arya, Secretary, Department of Official Language (Ministry of Home Affairs), made several noteworthy announcements that reflect the evolving approach to language policy in India. She shared that official correspondence from the Centre is now being sent in the languages of respective states‚Äîfor instance, letters to the Chief Minister of Tamil Nadu are sent in Tamil, not just Hindi or English. This move ensures that all Indian languages are treated with respect and seen as integral to the mainstream. Hindi Shabd Sindhu now has 7L words; aims to be world‚Äôs finest dictionary by 2029.
